info.title: Maps Messaging Rest Server
info.description: Maps Messaging Server Rest API, provides simple Rest API to manage and interact with the server

tags.name: Authentication and Authorisation Management
tags.description: Provides endpoints for managing user authentication and authorisation, including login, logout, token management, and role-based access control to ensure secure interactions with the server.

tags.name: Destination Management
tags.description: Facilitates the management of destinations such as topics and queues. Includes operations for creating, updating, deleting, and querying destinations, as well as managing subscriptions.

tags.name: Messaging Interface
tags.description: Offers APIs for sending and receiving messages, enabling communication between clients and the server. Supports various messaging protocols and real-time event handling.

tags.name: Server Health
tags.description: Includes endpoints for monitoring the server's health and operational status, providing simple and detailed responses for status checks and diagnostics.

tags.name: Server Interface Management
tags.description: Manages the server's network interfaces, including configuration, monitoring, and troubleshooting of connections to ensure optimal performance and reliability.

tags.name: Schema Management
tags.description: Provides functionality to configure, manage, and query schemas used by the server, enabling seamless integration with structured data formats and validation mechanisms.

tags.name: Server Management
tags.description: Includes operations for monitoring and managing the server's status, configurations, and performance metrics to ensure smooth and efficient operation.

tags.name: Server Integration Management
tags.description: Manages the server's integrations with other messaging brokers, enabling interoperability and seamless data exchange across distributed systems.

tags.name: Server Integration Status
tags.description: Retrieves the current status of the server to server integration.

tags.name: Connection Management
tags.description: Handles client connections to the server, offering endpoints for monitoring, managing, and troubleshooting active connections and session details.

tags.name: Discovery Management
tags.description: Provides mechanisms for managing the server's discovery agents, allowing automated detection and configuration of network services and resources.

tags.name: Hardware Management
tags.description: Enables the management of hardware devices integrated with the server, including configuration, monitoring, and diagnostics for seamless hardware-software interaction.

tags.name: LoRa Device Management
tags.description: Offers APIs for managing LoRa devices, including adding, updating, retrieving configurations, monitoring device statistics, and managing endpoint connections.

tags.name: Logging Monitor
tags.description: Offers simple API to retrieve server logs or to stream server logs via SSE

tags.name: User Authentication
tags.description: Provides the rest api login, logout and token refresh

tags.name: ML Model Store
tags.description: Endpoints for managing ML models in the system.

get.description: Returns information about the current user authentication session, can be used to see if the user is logged in

200.description: Returns if there have been updates

post.description: Allows a user to log in and obtain an authentication token. This endpoint does not require authentication and overrides global security settings.
Logs out the currently authenticated user by invalidating their session.

400.description: Bad request or invalid session state

get.description: Refreshes the current JWT cookie used for auth.

200.description: Refresh was successful or not required

get.description: Checks the health of all subsystems and returns their overall status. Possible values are 'Ok', 'Warning', or 'Error'.
Provides information about any changes in the server's configuration update counts.

200.description: Returns if there have been updates

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all destinations with optional filtering and sorting
get.description: Fetch a paginated list of all known destinations. You can filter the list using a selector string, limit the number of returned entries using the 'size' parameter, and sort the results by attributes such as Name, Published Messages, or Stored Messages. Cached results are returned if available to enhance performance. Authentication is required if the server configuration mandates it.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: An optional filter string for selecting specific destinations. The filter should be a valid expression that complies with the selector syntax.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The maximum number of destinations to return in the response. A default value is used if this parameter is not provided.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The attribute by which the list of destinations should be sorted before returning. Possible values include Name, Published, Delivered, Stored, Pending, Delayed, and Expired.

403.description: User is not authorised to access the resource

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information about a destination
get.description: Fetch detailed information for a specific destination identified by its name. Authentication is required if the server configuration mandates it. Cached results are returned if available to enhance performance.

parameters.name: destinationName
parameters.description: The name of the destination for which details are requested

get.description: Delivers messages via Server Side Events, supports MQTT wild card plus JMS style filtering

schema.title: Destination Name
schema.description: The name of the destination (e.g., topic or queue) to which the subscription is bound.Supports MQTT style wild card subscription

schema.title: Named Subscription
schema.description: An optional name for a named subscription, allowing clients to re-use existing subscriptions if provided.

schema.title: Filter Expression
schema.description: An optional filter expression written in JMS selector syntax to filter messages received by the subscription.

schema.title: Maximum Queue Depth
schema.description: The maximum number of messages that can be queued for the subscription before new messages are dropped.

schema.title: Retain Message
schema.description: Indicates if messages should be retained on the destination for this subscription, meaning they will be stored and made available to future subscribers.

GroupDTO.title: Group

name.title: Group Name
name.description: The name of the group, such as an administrative or user-defined role.

uniqueId.title: Group Unique ID
uniqueId.description: The unique identifier for the group, generated as a UUID.

usersList.title: Group Members
usersList.description: A list of unique IDs representing the members of this group.

items.title: Group Members
items.description: A list of unique IDs representing the members of this group.

GroupDTO.description: Represents a group of users within the system, identified by a unique name and ID.

NewUserDTO.title: New User

username.title: Username
username.description: The unique username for the new user account.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password or passphrase for the new user, intended to provide secure access.

NewUserDTO.description: Represents a new user account with a username and password.

UserDTO.title: User

username.title: Username
username.description: The unique name assigned to the user.

uniqueId.title: User Unique ID
uniqueId.description: The UUID representing this specific user, ensuring unique identification across the system.

groupList.title: User Group Memberships
groupList.description: A list of group names to which the user belongs, providing role-based access and permissions.

items.title: User Group Memberships
items.description: A list of group names to which the user belongs, providing role-based access and permissions.

attributes.title: User Attributes

additionalProperties.title: User Attributes
additionalProperties.description: A map of user-specific attributes, such as home directory or other key-value pairs for configuration.

attributes.description: A map of user-specific attributes, such as home directory or other key-value pairs for configuration.

UserDTO.description: Represents a user within the system, including username, unique ID, group memberships, and user-specific attributes.

EndPointSummaryDTO.title: End Point Information

adapter.description: Adapter name or type associated with this endpoint

protocolName.description: Name of the protocol used by the endpoint

protocolVersion.description: Version of the protocol used by the endpoint

proxyAddress.description: Proxy address used to connect the endpoint, if any

connectedTimeMs.description: Connection start time in milliseconds since epoch

lastRead.description: Timestamp of the last read operation in milliseconds since epoch

lastWrite.description: Timestamp of the last write operation in milliseconds since epoch

totalBytesRead.description: Total bytes read by the endpoint

totalBytesWritten.description: Total bytes written by the endpoint

bytesRead.description: Bytes read in the current interval

bytesWritten.description: Bytes written in the current interval

overFlow.description: Buffer overflow count in the current interval

underFlow.description: Buffer underflow count in the current interval

EndPointSummaryDTO.description: Provides overview information about the end point

EndPointDetailsDTO.title: End Point Information
EndPointDetailsDTO.description: Provides detailed information about the end point

ProtocolInformationDTO.title: Protocol Information

timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds before the protocol session is considered inactive

keepAlive.description: Keep-alive interval in milliseconds for protocol connections

messageTransformationName.description: Name of the message transformation applied to this protocol

additionalProperties.description: Mapping of selectors to protocol-specific expressions

selectorMapping.description: Mapping of selectors to protocol-specific expressions

additionalProperties.description: Mapping of destinations to transformation names

destinationTransformationMapping.description: Mapping of destinations to transformation names

ProtocolInformationDTO.description: Provides detailed information about the protocol and session

RemoteDeviceInfo.description: Information about the remote satellite device

bytesTransmitted.description: Total number of bytes transmitted through the satellite link

bytesReceived.description: Total number of bytes received through the satellite link

packetsSent.description: Total number of packets sent through the satellite link

packetsReceived.description: Total number of packets received through the satellite link

SessionInformationDTO.title: End Point Information
SessionInformationDTO.description: Provides detailed information about the session

SubscriptionInformationDTO.title: End Point Information
SubscriptionInformationDTO.description: Provides detailed information about the individual subscription

DestinationDTO.title: Destination

name.title: Destination Name
name.description: The unique name of the destination, which acts as an identifier within the messaging system.

type.title: Destination Type
type.description: The type of the destination, indicating whether it is a queue or a topic, for example.

storedMessages.title: Stored Messages
storedMessages.description: The total count of messages currently stored in the destination.

delayedMessages.title: Delayed Messages
delayedMessages.description: The number of messages delayed for delivery, which might occur due to timing or prioritization settings.

pendingMessages.title: Pending Messages
pendingMessages.description: The count of messages pending processing in the destination.

schemaId.title: Schema ID
schemaId.description: The identifier for the schema associated with this destination, which may define the structure or rules for messages.

noInterestMessages.title: No Interest Messages
noInterestMessages.description: The count of messages dropped due to lack of interest by consumers.

publishedMessages.title: Published Messages
publishedMessages.description: Total count of messages published to this destination.

retrievedMessages.title: Retrieved Messages
retrievedMessages.description: The total number of messages retrieved from the destination by consumers.

expiredMessages.title: Expired Messages
expiredMessages.description: The count of messages that expired before being delivered.

deliveredMessages.title: Delivered Messages
deliveredMessages.description: The number of messages successfully delivered to consumers.

readTimeAveNs.title: Average Read Time
readTimeAveNs.description: The average time, in nanoseconds, to read messages from the store.

writeTimeAveNs.title: Average Write Time
writeTimeAveNs.description: The average time, in nanoseconds, to write messages to the store.

deleteTimeAveNs.title: Average Delete Time
deleteTimeAveNs.description: The average time, in nanoseconds, to delete messages from the store.

DestinationDTO.description: Represents a messaging destination, such as a queue or topic, within the system.

enabled.description: Indicates if the discovery manager is enabled

DiscoveredServersDTO.title: Discovered Servers

serverName.title: Server Name
serverName.description: The unique name of the discovered server.

systemTopicPrefix.title: System Topic Prefix
systemTopicPrefix.description: The name space prefix used for system topics

schemaSupport.title: Schema Support
schemaSupport.description: Indicates whether the server supports schema validation for messages.

schemaPrefix.title: Schema Prefix
schemaPrefix.description: The name space prefix used for schemas

version.title: Server Version
version.description: The version of the server software, typically following semantic versioning.

buildDate.title: Build Date
buildDate.description: The date the server software was built, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

services.title: Services
services.description: A map of services provided by the server, where each key is the service name and the value provides service-specific information.

DiscoveredServersDTO.description: Represents information about discovered servers, including configuration details, schema support, and available services.

Services.title: Services
Services.description: A map of services provided by the server, where each key is the service name and the value provides service-specific information.

demoEnabled.description: Indicates if the device manager will load the demo devices

selector.description: Selector configuration for the device bus

DeviceInfoDTO.title: Device Information

name.title: Device Name
name.description: The unique name or identifier for the device.

description.title: Device Description
description.description: A brief description of the devices purpose or functionality.
description.example: Temperature sensor for monitoring room temperature

type.title: Device Type
type.description: The type or category of the device, indicating its general function or use.

state.title: Device State
state.description: Retrieves any state registers, could be sensor data or device state, is dependent on the device.

DeviceInfoDTO.description: Represents detailed information about a device, including its name, type, state, and description.

linkCredit.description: Link credit for the AMQP connection

durable.description: Specifies if the AMQP link is durable

incomingCapacity.description: Incoming capacity of the AMQP session

outgoingWindow.description: Outgoing window size for the AMQP session

sessionId.description: Session ID for the authentication session

additionalProperties.description: Configuration settings for the token generator

tokenConfig.description: Configuration settings for the token generator

idleTime.description: Idle time period for CoAP connections in seconds

packetReuseTimeout.description: Timeout for reusing packets, in milliseconds

idleSessionTimeout.description: Idle session timeout duration, in seconds

hmacHostLookupCacheExpiry.description: Expiry time for HMAC host lookup cache, in seconds

hmacConfigList.description: List of HMAC configurations for nodes

type.example: tcp, ssl, udp, dtls, loraSerial, loraDevice, serial

serverReadBufferSize.description: Server read buffer size in bytes

serverWriteBufferSize.description: Server write buffer size in bytes

proxyProtocolMode.description: Proxy Protocol support mode. 'ENABLED' allows but doesn't require it, 'REQUIRED' enforces it, 'DISABLED' will NOT check for incoming PROXY requests.

allowedProxyHosts.description: Comma-separated list of allowed proxy source addresses. Supports hostnames, IPv4/IPv6 addresses, and CIDR blocks (e.g., 192.168.0.0/24, ::1, example.com).

connectionTimeout.description: Time to wait for a client to establish the connection, in milliseconds

EndPointConfigDTO.description: Abstract base class for all schema configurations

protocolConfigs.description: List of protocol configurations for the endpoint

linkTransformation.description: Link transformation for the endpoint connection

pluginConnection.description: Is this a 3rd party plugin connection

cost.description: An arbitrary cost associated with using this connection

groupName.description: Optional name of the group that the connection belongs to

host.description: The host for the HMAC configuration

port.description: The port used for HMAC communication

secret.description: The secret key for HMAC operations

hmacSharedKey.description: The shared key used for HMAC

IntegrationInfoDTO.title: Integration Information
IntegrationInfoDTO.description: Provides configuration and details about a specific integration connection.

alias.description: Alias used in the key store

path.description: Path to the key store file

provider.description: Provider name for the key store

qualityOfService.description: Quality of server QoS:0, 1 or 2, for non MQTT  1 or 2 imply transactional
enum: QualityOfService.AT_MOST_ONCE(level=0, description=Best Effort, no guarantee of delivery, storeOffLine=false, sendPacketId=false, clientAcknowledgement=AUTO)

QualityOfService.AT_LEAST_ONCE(level=1, description=Guarantees at least once but may be duplicated delivery if connection fails between sending and Ack, storeOffLine=true, sendPacketId=true, clientAcknowledgement=INDIVIDUAL)

QualityOfService.EXACTLY_ONCE(level=2, description=Only once delivery, in that the event is delivered to the client once and once only, storeOffLine=true, sendPacketId=true, clientAcknowledgement=INDIVIDUAL)

QualityOfService.MQTT_SN_REGISTERED(level=3, description=Used by MQTT-SN to send publish events to a known topic without the need to have a connection established, this is reserved for MQTT-SN, storeOffLine=true, sendPacketId=false, clientAcknowledgement=AUTO)

frequency.description: Operating frequency of the device in MHz

transmissionRate.description: Transmission rate to limit the number of packets/second, 0 - unlimited, else per second

radio.description: Radio type of the LoRa device

frequency.description: Operating frequency of the device in MHz

transmissionRate.description: Transmission rate to limit the number of packets/second, 0 - unlimited, else per second

enum: QualityOfService.AT_MOST_ONCE(level=0, description=Best Effort, no guarantee of delivery, storeOffLine=false, sendPacketId=false, clientAcknowledgement=AUTO)

QualityOfService.AT_LEAST_ONCE(level=1, description=Guarantees at least once but may be duplicated delivery if connection fails between sending and Ack, storeOffLine=true, sendPacketId=true, clientAcknowledgement=INDIVIDUAL)

QualityOfService.EXACTLY_ONCE(level=2, description=Only once delivery, in that the event is delivered to the client once and once only, storeOffLine=true, sendPacketId=true, clientAcknowledgement=INDIVIDUAL)

QualityOfService.MQTT_SN_REGISTERED(level=3, description=Used by MQTT-SN to send publish events to a known topic without the need to have a connection established, this is reserved for MQTT-SN, storeOffLine=true, sendPacketId=false, clientAcknowledgement=AUTO)

meta.description: Metadata to inject if not present in the message

strictClientId.description: Indicates if strict client ID enforcement is enabled

maximumSessionExpiry.description: Maximum session expiry time in seconds

strictClientId.description: Indicates if strict client ID enforcement is enabled

minServerKeepAlive.description: Minimum server keep-alive interval in seconds

maxServerKeepAlive.description: Maximum server keep-alive interval in seconds

proxyProtocol.description: Support Proxy Protocol on the connection

realmName.description: The realm name used for SASL authentication

mechanism.description: The SASL mechanism, such as PLAIN or SCRAM-SHA-256

SaslConfigDTO.description: Represents the configuration for SASL authentication used for REST communication.

incomingMessagePollInterval.description: Time in seconds to poll the modem for incoming messages

outgoingMessagePollInterval.description: Time in seconds to poll for outgoing messages

maxBufferSize.description: maximum buffer size allowed by the satellite communications

compressionCutoffSize.description: minimum sized buffer that will be compressed

messageLifeTimeInMinutes.description: life time of message in minutes

bridgeMode.description: In Bridge mode the server simply passes any event, unchanged over the satellite link, if false then the server will collect events and send in 1 packets

sendHighPriorityMessages.description: If set, then high priority messages will NOT be queued, will incur additional charges

httpRequestTimeout.description: HTTP Request time out in seconds

maxInflightEventsPerDevice.description: Max number of events to be in flight per each modems

outboundNamespaceRoot.description: Namespace path for outbound topic mapping for individual modems

outboundBroadcast.description: Namespace path for outbound topic broadcast for all devices

deviceInfoUpdateMinutes.description: Device Info update time in minutes

inboundTopicName.description: Inbound topic name for Semtech messages

outboundTopicName.description: Outbound topic name for Semtech messages

type.example: tcp, ssl, udp, dtls, loraSerial, loraDevice, serial

serverReadBufferSize.description: Server read buffer size in bytes

serverWriteBufferSize.description: Server write buffer size in bytes

proxyProtocolMode.description: Proxy Protocol support mode. 'ENABLED' allows but doesn't require it, 'REQUIRED' enforces it, 'DISABLED' will NOT check for incoming PROXY requests.

allowedProxyHosts.description: Comma-separated list of allowed proxy source addresses. Supports hostnames, IPv4/IPv6 addresses, and CIDR blocks (e.g., 192.168.0.0/24, ::1, example.com).

connectionTimeout.description: Time to wait for a client to establish the connection, in milliseconds

baudRate.description: Baud rate for the serial connection

dataBits.description: Number of data bits in the serial connection

stopBits.description: Number of stop bits in the serial connection

parity.description: Parity setting for the serial connection

flowControl.description: Flow control setting for the serial connection

serialNo.description: Serial number for the device, optional

crlInterval.description: Interval in milliseconds for CRL refresh

statisticName.title: name of the statistic engine to run

eventCount.title: Number of events

items.title: Ignore List

items.title: Key List
items.description: Specific set of keys to use rather than auto discovery this is used to refine the keys used

sendHighPriorityMessages.description: If set, then high priority messages will NOT be queued, will incur additional charges

stats.title: Statistics Map

MessageDTO.title: Message

payload.title: Payload
payload.description: The main payload content of the message, represented as a byte64 string.

contentType.title: Content Type
contentType.description: The MIME type of the message payload, indicating its format.

correlationData.title: Correlation Data
correlationData.description: Additional data used for correlating messages, provided as a byte array.

expiry.title: Expiry Time
expiry.description: The expiry time for the message in milliseconds. Default is -1, indicating no expiry.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority level of the message, ranging from 0 (lowest) to 10 (highest). Default is 4 (normal).

qualityOfService.title: Quality of Service
qualityOfService.description: The Quality of Service level for the message: 0 (at most once), 1 (at least once), or 2 (exactly once).

creation.title: Creation Date/Time
creation.description: The time the server received this event

dataMap.title: Message Parameters

additionalProperties.title: Message Parameters
additionalProperties.description: A map containing optional key-value pairs associated with the message.

dataMap.description: A map containing optional key-value pairs associated with the message.

metaData.title: Event Meta Data

additionalProperties.title: Event Meta Data
additionalProperties.description: A map of string, string values that the server has added to the event as it was processed

metaData.description: A map of string, string values that the server has added to the event as it was processed

MessageDTO.description: Represents a messaging entity with configurable quality, priority, and metadata attributes.

destination.title: Destination name

depth.title: Depth
depth.description: The max number of events that should be returned

PublishRequestDTO.title: Publish Request

destinationName.title: Destination Topic
destinationName.description: The topic to which the message will be published. This should be a valid topic name recognized by the messaging system.

retain.title: Retain Message
retain.description: Indicates if the message should be retained on the destination. If true, the message will be stored and sent to new subscribers on the topic.

PublishRequestDTO.description: Represents a request to publish a message to a specified topic with optional retention.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority level of the message, ranging from 0 (lowest) to 10 (highest). Default is 4 (normal).

qualityOfService.title: Quality of Service
qualityOfService.description: The Quality of Service level for the message: 0 (at most once), 1 (at least once), or 2 (exactly once).

SubscriptionRequestDTO.title: Subscription Request

destinationName.title: Destination Name
destinationName.description: The name of the destination (e.g., topic or queue) to which the subscription is bound.Supports MQTT style wild card subscription

namedSubscription.title: Named Subscription
namedSubscription.description: An optional name for a named subscription, allowing clients to re-use existing subscriptions if provided.

filter.title: Filter Expression
filter.description: An optional filter expression written in JMS selector syntax to filter messages received by the subscription.

maxDepth.title: Maximum Queue Depth
maxDepth.description: The maximum number of messages that can be queued for the subscription before new messages are dropped.

transactional.title: Transactional subscription
transactional.description: Flag to indicate the subscription is transactional

retainMessage.title: Retain Message
retainMessage.description: Indicates if messages should be retained on the destination for this subscription, meaning they will be stored and made available to future subscribers.

SubscriptionRequestDTO.description: Represents a request to create a subscription to a specific destination, with optional filtering and message retention.

incrementPriorityMethod.description: On rollback of events if we maintain the priority or bump the priority of the event
